title: Loss of display
body:
Ok so I will start from the beginning. I started making upgrades to my PC hardware the beginning of October 2016. At that time, I started noticing issues were my PC would lose display completely. Both screens go black, blue lights turn orange on monitors, and the hardware (Fans - PSU- Etc..) would still be running. At this point I am unable to to restart my PC unless I cut the power plug or flick switch on PSU. After removing all new pieces of hardware, the issue was still happening. As of the last 4 times its happened, was at the end of a match on summoners rift, right as the defeat or Win graphics come up. I have never had this happen before that. i am thinking it is a coincidence or timing that something updated/changed when i installed new hardware into my PC but I would like to see if anyone else has experienced this exact same issue. 

System Specs:

-Windows 10 Home
-AMD FX-8350 8 Core 4.0GHz
-16GB 1833Mhz RAM
-AMD Radeon R7 200 Series (Have a  MSI Radeon RX 480 DirectX 12 RX 480 GAMING X 8G 8GB 256-Bit GDDR that was installed but RMA'd it for replacement because I thought it was the issue to this problem)
-500GB Samsung 750 Evo SSD
-850W LEPA G Series PSU
-MSI 970 Gaming Mobo

replies.body:
Do you have a PC speaker (small speaker connected directly to the motherboard) installed? 
If you have, does it beep more than once at any time?

Did you change your motherboard with this upgrade? And if you did, did you reinstall Windows? 
This should be done when changing motherboard.

If you upgraded your GPU, did you do a _clean_ install (removing all traces of older drivers) of any updated video drivers?
Did you change out your motherboard when you swapped in new hardware? I suspect this may be the culprit if it's one of the pieces that remained constant between your old + new build.
